intro: Ruellia biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. Ruellia biflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
